programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Vendée, from Les Sables-d'Olonne to the Marais Poitevin Its endless sandy beaches put the Vendée amongst the French holidaymakers' favourite summer destinations. A paradise for tourists, from exploring the Marais Poitevin marshes aboard a flat-bottomed boat, to taking the ferry to the island of Noirmoutier before continuing the visit in Les Sables-d'Olonne, Fontenay-le-Comte, Vouvant, Mortagne-sur-Sèvre and Les Herbiers. Directed by: Mélodie Proust (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Périgord, generous by nature The Dordogne, reputed for its scenery and its heritage. From the attractive city of Bergerac to Monbazillac, the Proumeyssac Chasm and the river meanders of Limeuil and Trémolat, there's no shortage of gems to discover! Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Game meat
Venison, duck, boar, emu, elk, bison... What place does game have in our fridges today? Also on the programme: freeze-drying for zero waste; mascarpone, the king of Italian cream cheeses; and if, as they say, an army marches on its stomach, what do Canadian soldiers actually eat?
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Bouches-du-Rhône, from Camargue to rocky calanques In south-eastern France, the Bouches-du-Rhône is a department justly proud of the diversity of its landscapes: the Camargue's marshy plain, nature reserves and renowned towns steeped in history. The region is also home to some authentic gems: Arles, Paul Cézanne's studio in Aix-en-Provence, the majestic calanques of Cassis and Marseille. Directed by: Annalisa Guérin (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Between Creuse and Corrèze, marvellous nature Exploring the great outdoors through mountains and magical scenery. We head to the heart of the Millevaches Plateau, a region also known as France's water tower because of the innumerable lakes and watercourses that have their sources here. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Natural wines
The market for natural wines is constantly growing... Farm-restaurants: a new trend? What's on the menu at a mi'kmaw wedding? Goji and açai berries, chia seeds, do all these so-called super foods really have miraculous properties?
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Bouches-du-Rhône, from Camargue to rocky calanques In south-eastern France, the Bouches-du-Rhône is a department justly proud of the diversity of its landscapes: the Camargue's marshy plain, nature reserves and renowned towns steeped in history. The region is also home to some authentic gems: Arles, Paul Cézanne's studio in Aix-en-Provence, the majestic calanques of Cassis and Marseille. Directed by: Annalisa Guérin (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Espinouse Massif
In the Espinouse Massif, we meet Lilian and his swarm of bees. At the Les Taillades Farm, Aline and Guillaume have plenty to keep them busy, between caring for the animals and maturing the cheeses. All you need to know about the Pardailhan turnip; exploring the Hérépian Bell Museum.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Who understands Burgundian? Sandwiched between Paris and Lyon and spanning Burgundy's four départements, the Morvan area has own unique characteristics and customs. Can someone from Belfort, Jura or even Dijon understand the Burgundian language? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Ice lollies
Ice lollies, from 2002 to today. Gelato, paletas... and not forgetting the affogato that combines two Italian passions: coffee and ice cream, plus vegan ice creams!
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Le LACMA, Los Angeles Le musée d'Art du comté de Los Angeles, le LACMA, est le plus grand musée de l'Ouest américain. Dès la fin du XIXe siècle, les artistes américains venaient séjourner en France, passionnés par les courants cubistes ou d'art abstrait. Monet, Renoir, Cézanne, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Braque, Kandinsky furent leurs maîtres... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Aude, from Carcassonne to the Cathar Country Above all known for its mediaeval towns and its Cathar history, the French department of the Aude also offers some impressive scenery: the Corbières Massif and the Galamus Gorges. Superbly preserved, on the banks of the Canal du Midi and the River Aude, Carcassonne is a town forgotten by time. Directed by: Philippe Vergeot (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Between Creuse and Corrèze, marvellous nature Exploring the great outdoors through mountains and magical scenery. We head to the heart of the Millevaches Plateau, a region also known as France's water tower because of the innumerable lakes and watercourses that have their sources here. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
They're the future of fashion: discover the fashion show for students of the Institut Français de la Mode. Learn all about the padded jacket. Interview with Valentine H Despointes, a leatherwork artist. Wearing the colour brown. The architect Régis Botta presents one of his projects: a bright, simple duplex.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Michel Roth
He is one of France's most highly-qualified chefs. Michel Roth is back in Marseille, where he spent his childhood and learned his trade. An opportunity for the Lorraine-born chef to immerse himself in the land he loves, surrounded by family and friends: where good food is served with emotion.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as an outdoor adventure guide On the banks of Cambell River, Julien meets up with Bastian. Former banker turned helicopter pilot, he left Switzerland to start again from nothing. He takes Julien off to explore the endless playground that surrounds him, by boat, campervan and air. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Homemade corn tortillas
For an easy-to-prepare way to serve prawn tacos and a mango salsa, Ricardo cooks his own home-made corn tortillas for a flavour that's even more authentic.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Le LACMA, Los Angeles Le musée d'Art du comté de Los Angeles, le LACMA, est le plus grand musée de l'Ouest américain. Dès la fin du XIXe siècle, les artistes américains venaient séjourner en France, passionnés par les courants cubistes ou d'art abstrait. Monet, Renoir, Cézanne, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Braque, Kandinsky furent leurs maîtres... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Var, from Saint-Tropez to the Verdon Gorges Renowned for Saint-Tropez the department of the Var offers innumerable other idyllic destinations. We explore from the Bandol vineyards, bathed in southern sunshine and a mild Mediterranean climate, to the dramatic coast where the Corniche des Maures and the flame-red rocks of the Esterel Massif reveal their spectacular natural landscapes. Directed by: Audrey Varet (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Between Creuse and Corrèze, marvellous nature Exploring the great outdoors through mountains and magical scenery. We head to the heart of the Millevaches Plateau, a region also known as France's water tower because of the innumerable lakes and watercourses that have their sources here. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Jouy-en-Josas, to visit the Toile de Jouy museum. The Argentinean chef Juan Arbelaez invites us into his kitchen, filled with a thousand and one flavours. Schiaparelli, the perfect combination of art and fashion through collections inspired by surrealism. The restorer Isabelle Pitre offers paintings and artworks all their original beauty. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Fried chicken and waffles Bob le Chef goes for a buttermilk-based cuisine with his two recipes today: fried chicken and waffles. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Éva and Alex, Montérégie (West Bolton) The birth of Éva and Alex's baby led them to leave their shared rental in the Rosemont district of Montreal for a house in Montérégie. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Treats for dogs
The pandemic saw a rise in the number of pets being adopted. Result: the range of products on offer also increased! But how to make the right choice? Also on the programme: different types of Asian sauces, a focus on Indian bread and the range of crèmes caramel now available.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Musée de l'Ermitage, Saint-Pétersbourg À Saint-Pétersbourg, en Russie, l'Ermitage abrite la plus grande collection du monde de peintures, avec plus de seize mille tableaux. Des salles spectaculaires couvrent les grands courants de la période moderne, de l'impressionnisme à l'art abstrait, avec des toiles de Monet, Renoir, Cézanne, Seurat, Van Gogh, Derain, entre autres... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Rigoletto Three acts and four scenes for "Rigoletto", by Giuseppe Verdi, based on a play by Victor Hugo "Le Roi S'Amuse", created at the Teatro La Fenice in 1851. With extracts from Claus Guth's 2016 production at the Opéra de Paris. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)
